properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms are possible tonight. Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms late this evening and overnight. These storms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-08T14:00:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T03:01:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2740940171.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season continues tonight as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northwestern Ontario from the United States. Minimum temperatures tonight are expected to be near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Saturday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T15:00:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T07:01:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2003730975.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected today as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northern Ontario from the United States. Maximum daytime temperatures are expected to be near 30 degrees Celsius on Saturday with minimum temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Sunday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T17:19:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T09:20:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3535214782.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected today as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northern Ontario from the United States. Maximum daytime temperatures are expected to be near 30 degrees Celsius today and minimum temperature near 18 degrees Celsius tonight. Cooler air is expected to arrive Sunday afternoon after the passage of a slow moving cold front. Ogoki Post may reach 30 degrees Celsius again on Sunday if the cold front reaches the community late in the day. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T17:57:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T09:58:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3539391161.2019
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop to near the freezing mark overnight tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T17:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T02:02:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4139858271.2019
Area: Ashuapmushuan Wildlife Reserve area, Normandin - Péribonka area, Alma - Desbiens area, Saint-Félicien - Roberval area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke from wildfires is causing poor air quality in some locations. Air quality conditions are expected to improve when the smoke exits the region later this morning. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T21:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-08T10:19:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0618541585.2019
Area: Thorhild Co. near Thorhild Opal and Radway, Sturgeon Co. near Bon Accord Gibbons and Namao, Sturgeon Co. near Redwater, Lamont Co. near Bruderheim Lamont and Peno Creek, Lamont Co. near Andrew and Wostok, Lamont Co. near Mundare Chipman and Ukrainian Village, Smoky Lake Co. near Smoky Lake and Waskatenau, Co. of Two Hills near Willingdon and Hairy Hill, Fort Saskatchewan and Nrn Strathcona Co., Elk Island Nat. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. The severe thunderstorm threat continues late Friday night, as further thunderstorm development taking place in North Dakota is expected to move into the Red River Valley and parts of eastern Manitoba overnight. Severe thunderstorms will be possible through much of the overnight hours. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T12:31:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T05:20:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1492099090.2019

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from a forest fire east of Pikangikum have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-09T01:38:29-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Extremely hot conditions on Friday are providing for a favourable environment for severe thunderstorms to persist tonight and track northeastward across southeastern Manitoba. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system moving across northern Saskatchewan continues to bring heavy rain to the region. An additional 5 to 10 mm of rain is expected before the system exits the province this afternoon. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
